event.name: FEDERATION_BASE
event.text: The Federation base in this reality is just as impressive as the one back in Universe 0. Much of the city below has been evacuated, but the capitol building, the center of operations, is still operational. If the Flagship destroys it, the Federation will be powerless and this reality will be lost.
Luckily you've arrived here before the Flagship. One of the few remaining Federation support ships patches up your hull and gives a few supplies.

event.name: LASTSTAND_WARP_REAL
event.text:
Name: Federation Capital Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: The Federation Rebel Threat Level: !CRITICALLY HIGH!
The Federation Capital is your final destination. Under siege by the Rebellion, to save this reality you must eliminate the Rebel Flagship before it destroys the Federation base.

choice.text: There's no more time for other sectors!

event.name: TRUE_LAST_STAND_START_EMERGENCY
event.text: It seems your impromptu departure from Node 17 has spelled disaster for the Federation. The Flagship has already reached the base and the Federation forces here are overwhelmed. There's no time to waste, you need to get to the base immediately!

event.name: TRUE_LAST_STAND_START_EXTREME
event.text: The second you exit light speed, it becomes clear something is wrong. It looks as though the entrance beacon is under attack by an MFK Ace!

event.name: LAST_STAND_START_EXTREME_FINISH
event.text: The MFK Ace has been taken care of, and you scrap the remains before carrying on. You contact the survivors of the Federation fleet, including Admiral Tully himself.

event.name: DETERGENT_WIN
event.text: Before you can leave, you receive another hail from Tully. "Wait - is that detergent you have? Oh thank Newton, the Rebel blockade has drained us of essential supplies, and we have a surplus of uniforms to clean. It's not much, but with this, maybe we can get our troops back into shape!"

DETERGENT MODE COMPLETE! Congratulations Renegade on successfully completing DETERGENT MODE! It was a turbulent journey for certain, but you've pulled through triumphantly! The Federation shall have dirty laundry no more, thanks to you.

event.name: DETERGENT_WIN_TULLY
event.text: Before you can leave, Tully brings up another subject. "Wait - is that detergent you have? Oh thank Newton, the Rebel blockade has drained us of essential supplies, and we have a surplus of uniforms to clean. It's not much, but with this, maybe we can get our troops back into shape!"

DETERGENT MODE COMPLETE! Congratulations Renegade on successfully completing DETERGENT MODE! It was a turbulent journey for certain, but you've pulled through triumphantly! The Federation shall have dirty laundry no more, thanks to you.

event.name: TRUE_LAST_STAND_START
event.text: You've finally arrived at Node 17, the Federation Capital. You've heard the stories of this conflict back in Universe 0, the reality where the Multiverse tech was discovered. Now, you're about to take a part in it. Your actions here will either save or doom this reality.
With a quick scan of your ID, you are allowed through the beacon without issue.

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "So you're the Multiverse ship I've heard about? You've come a long way, and I can only hope it's all paid off. You're the Federation's last stand against the Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Oh dear god, the Rebellion's sent ANOTHER Flagship? We're screwed... wait, you aren't with the Rebels. Universe 0 sent the Rebel's super weapon to destroy the super weapon? I guess it's about freaking time we fight fire with fire."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "A... pirate? I didn't know we hired mercenaries... Not that it's an issue, you're here now and you're probably the best chance we've got."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Is that... Tuco? Which one of you hired Tuco as a mercenary? Well, I appreciate your... dedication to the Federation. Let us just hope that it pays off."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "A gambling vessel. I'm not certain where these ships are coming from, but if you're the key to defeating the Flagship, then I'm not going to complain."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "That's a very bright ship you have. I'm sure a fascinating story stands behind it. I'd love to hear it some day, assuming we aren't all dead at the end of this."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "In all my years, I never thought the Federation's last chance, our saving grace, would fall upon... a Slug Pleasure Cruiser. I can't imagine how you stand piloting that thing. At least, it looks like you've made it combat ready enough to face the Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Woah, your ship has taken quite the beating. If I didn't know better, I would have assumed you showed up already dead. Let's hope that isn't the fate you await."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I thought the Dynasty was determined to avoid the Federation and let us battle to extinction with the Rebels? Has the Prime Reaper finally changed his mind and given us a second chance? Well, I'm grateful. We need all the help we can get against the Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I can't seem to explain it, but witnessing your ship gives me the urge to make an Old-Earth reference, but I'm afraid it would be too outdated."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center "A Lanius vessel? Or... whatever that is. Not sure where you got that paintjob from, but let's hope your ship is as deadly as it looks."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Your ship looks like the holograms I've seen of the original Multiverse drive. I hope that means you've brought the best tech you could, because you're our last line of defense."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I wasn't told we were receiving more reinforcements from the Engi. I'm glad, because our forces are almost dried up."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I didn't think the Zoltans would ever show up. Glad to know they had the dedication to bring exactly one ship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "What in god's name are you? I've never seen a Zoltan ship or a creature like you before... But it seems you're a better ally than the Ministry if you've actually come to help us."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I didn't know the Federation had access to Duskbringer tech. I'm not sure how to think about this, but we have more pressing matters."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Support from the Hive? I can't say this was expected. Not that I'm complaining, we need all the help we can get against the Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Is that the Gyges? I thought that ship was destroyed in the Federation-Mantis war... I'll never get used to this Multiverse stuff."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Oh, I did not realise your ship was of Free Mantis origins. I didn't predict what valuable allies they would be, but I suppose it makes sense, with Mantis being such excellent fighters."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "The Rock Elders sent a cruiser to fight for us? I can't imagine their reasoning, but you're our last chance if we want to win this fight."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I thought the Outcasts were indifferent to the war. Well, I'm not one to turn down the help. We need every ship we can get to take down this Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I'm surprised the Lost Suns took the effort to provide any assistance. Perhaps I underestimated them as allies. I'm glad you've arrived, we're on our last leg and need all the help we can get."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "A cult? I... sure, not the strangest thing I've seen. Let's hope that massive ship of yours is ready for the Flagship, yes?"

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Assistance from the Crystalline people? Not the last thing I expected, but certainly not the first either. Let us both hope your Crystal tech will stand against the Rebellion's Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Slugs? Why did it have to be Slugs... I'm sure you're here looking for a reward, and perhaps we can work out a deal afterwards. But first, we need to take out the Flagship. The Federation can't stand much more of this attack, and if you came all this way I'm certain you mean business."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I didn't realize the Eargen Republic had the resources to send in a ship to help the Federation. No less, I'm glad you're here. Let's hope those tales of the once mighty Leech military were true and we're about to see a resurgence, because we sure as hell need it."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. He recoils in shock at the sight of your ship. "A Coalition vessel? This must be some joke... the only reason I can fathom receiving support from the Coalition would be our mutual enemy in the Rebellion. If so, then we can use all the help we can get, even from unlikely allies."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Orchids, hmmm? I didn't think your kind would take it upon yourselves to assist in this battle. I'm grateful for the reinforcements, we're running thin on soldiers and ships and every ounce of help is worth millions."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Vampweeds? I cannot say I expected any support from the Confederacy. Is all of that drama from the Federation-Mantis War finally water under the bridge? Well, I suspect not... but we can discuss this later. Right now there's a Flagship that needs killing."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "A Shell cruiser, huh? I heard your kind was rather reclusive... well, I appreciate your assistance. Let's hope that your efforts not go in vain, yes?"

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. He recoils in shock at the sight of your ship. "A Lanius warship, how interesting. I've never been certain of the Lanius's loyalties or motivation, but if you've come this far I have no doubt you've come to aid us in our fight."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "It's good to know the Union still has our backs. Every day it feels more and more Unionists turn to the Rebellion, but if the Union is still producing loyal Renegades back in Universe 0 then we might just have hope. We're all counting on you, captain. Make me proud."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Good, looks like you've brought a well-armed Federation ship. Welcome to the Last Stand, captain."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Ah, a Stealth ship, no wonder I never got any clear readings on the details of your vessel. No matter, let us both hope that your ship will be strong enough to take down the Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. He recoils in shock at the sight of your ship. "I never believed in a million years the ship who would be saving the Federation would be a Rebel vessel. I'm sure you have your reasons for betraying the Rebellion, and I'd love to hear them, but we have more pressing matters to deal with, such as the Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. He takes a step back as he takes in your ship. "Um... I don't know what you are, or why Universe 0 hired an automated ship as a Renegade, but if whatever you are is the solution to our problem then... be my guest? But I'll be keeping my eye on you..."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "W.I. sent a ship to assist the Federation? Seems... paradoxical, but I've seen far stranger Renegades come by before. If you're here to help, we'll take any we can get. Good luck against that Flagship, captain."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "A Kestrel? Don't see many of those outside of salvage fleets. Looks like your ship has come full circle... I can only hope it'll pay off."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "That is quite the colorful ship you have there. The Monks are pacifists, yes? Well, let's both hope you have a plan for dealing with that Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Hmm, you're that merchant I've heard so much about. Sylvan, wasn't it? Odd, I swear you already arrived here a while ago... I may never wrap my head around this Multiverse stuff. Regardless, I'm glad to have you here. Let's hope you're prepared for that Flagship."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Monks? I... I don't mean to be disrespectful, but aren't monks, you know, normally pacifists? I guess you're the exception then. As long as you deal with the Flagship, I don't care who you are."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "I swear, every day another race comes popping out of the Multiverse. This time it's... Salt? I think I've heard a legend or two about you. Let's hope you stay true to your legacy, yeah?"
On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Ack! Spiders?! I hate spiders! God damn it, just looking at your ship gives me shivers."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Your ship there, well, it strikes a strong resemblance to a vessel I knew from a long, long, long time ago. Never matter, that's far in the past. Let's focus on the present right now, we don't have time to reminisce."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "You'd probably expect me to be surprised to see my own ship here, but this is actually the 7th iteration of myself I've met so far. Now go get that Flagship, you beautiful bastard."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. As soon as he sees your ship, he hangs up immediately, but reconnects not long after. "No. You can't be serious. They sent THIS ship to save us? Is this some sick stupid joke?" Tully sighs. "Well unfortunately, you're the Federation's last hope. Try not to throw it all away, okay? We're all counting on you now."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. As soon as he sees your ship, he hangs up immediately, but reconnects not long after. "Horse? Horse friend!" Tully pauses and corrects his posture. "Er- sorry about that. I don't know what came over me. But, if you take down that Flagship, please let me pet a horse."

On the vidscreen appears several Federation and Engi officers, as well as Admiral Tully in the center. "Your ship... I've never seen a kind like that before. Clearly, the Multiverse still holds many secrets I have yet to see. If you understand what I'm saying, and you're friendly, then please. We need any help we can get in this fight. We're all counting on you, as strange as that sounds."

You scan your ID, but something appears wrong. A nearby Federation ship approaches, and you notice their weapons are online. You receive a hail from the ship. "You've been on quite the escapade in your journey here. I'm afraid the Federation simply cannot support someone with so many bad marks on their record. If you want any shot at forgiveness, eliminating the Flagship would be a good place to start." On that note, they cut comms.

event.name: LAST_STAND_START_2
event.text: "I'm afraid we don't have any more time to chat. Is there anything you need before you face the Flagship?" Tully orders the support ships on stand-by, awaiting your command.
Tully dispatches a Federation support ship to repair your hull.

choice.text: Request fuel and a sector map.

event.text: Tully dispatches a refueling drone to restore your fuel reserves, and transfers map data of the sector.
Tully dispatches a resupply drone to restore your reserves.
Tully dispatches a trained Federation soldier to serve on your ship.

choice.text: We need not of your assistance. The Great Eye will guide us.

event.text: You make a prayer to the Eye, wishing for save travels through this sector. The eye abides, and you find your ship stocked and ready to go.
As soon as Tully lays his eyes on the box, he changes his posture completely. He permits you inside the Federation command.

event.name: TULLY_CONTACT
event.text: Tully sits down with you, and places the box on the table in front of you. "Do you know what's inside this package?" You shake your head. "Well I'll tell you. Absolutely nothing." The confused look on your face makes Tully chuckle. "I gave these packages to several important Federation officials. They are to be given to those who they deem trustworthy and are to be brought to me. It's a sign that you really are worthy of this final fight. We best get going then, this Flagship won't destroy itself."

event.name: LASTSTAND_EMPTY_BEACON
event.text: Now that you're all ready to go, you have some time to do something on the ship. These moments will be few and far between in this sector, so take this chance to do whatever you might need, talk to your crew, and look at your mission report one last time!

event.name: BOSS_AUTOMATED
event.text: It appears this ship is also equipped with an advanced AI system. Now that the crew is dead, it has taken control! You sense oxygen levels dropping on the Flagship as well...

event.name: BOSS_DESTROYED
event.text: Its explosion rocks your ship and you shudder with relief. You did it. The Federation is saved....

Thanks for playing! Keep in mind this is still in beta and we have not created a satisfying conclusion to the game. Head to our forums to give us some feedback and let us know that you beat it. Thanks!

event.name: BOSS_ESCAPED
event.text: Just as you finally gain the upper hand it finds a way to make an FTL jump. You've got to keep up the assault!

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_1
event.text: This is it... The Rebel Flagship. If you are able to destroy this monstrosity, the Federation fleet will have a chance of surviving. There's no turning back!

choice.text: Perhaps there could be a reconciliation of our ideals without war?

event.text: The Flagship's commander blinks, confused. "Hah, spoken like a foolish, peace loving monk! You would not know the importance of this movement! Your loyalties to the Federation blind you from the importance of the Rebellion! When have YOU ever gone up against oppression?"

choice.text: We inspired a rebellion within the Rock Homeworlds to overthrow Stonewall.
We defied the Ministry and saved an entire planet from their oppression.
We went up against the Hive and raided their private hatcheries.
We overthrew Tyrdeo and brought about a new era to the Eargen Republic.
We dethroned Nights and convinced the Kleptocracy to turn to democracy.
We exposed the flaws of the Duskbringer movement by stopping a Syndicate attack that attempted to frame the Federation.
We saved the life of the Confederate Premier and ousted Coalition conspirators within their government.

event.text: The commander scoffs. "Oh, how pitiful. I tire of this conversation. There will be no peaceful resolution to this confrontation." He cuts comms, and the Flagship continues to charge its weapons.
The Flagship doesn't take long to notice you. Before it can begin to target you, Jerry taps into the Rebel comms and requests them to pause, demanding they put him on a line with Vance.
The Flagship doesn't take long to notice you. It powers up its artilleries and approaches.

As you approach the Flagship, you receive a hail from its captain. "You... you're the monster who murdered Jerome Wentworth. You hideous, repulsive, vile scum. You claim we're villains, yet you murder the kindest spirit in the whole galaxy in cold blood? Vance gave us direct orders to see to it your mission ends here, but frankly? I don't need those orders. I'm going to enjoy watching you die, as will all the rest of the galaxy."

event.name: FLAGSHIP_JERRY
event.text: Not too long later, Vance appears on your screen, his bright orange uniform and massive, muscular figure standing out from the faded white of the officers around him. You aren't sure where Vance is, but that no longer matters.

Vance stares down to look at his star nephew, a look of confusion upon his face. "Jerome? Have you been taken by this scum to be used as a mere trading good with me? How pathetic of the Federation. Do not worry nephew, I will send my finest strike force to rescue you." Jerry shakes his head. "N-no sir. I'm no hostage. I've come to bargain."

"Bargain? You aren't making any sense boy. Spit it out already. How much are the Feds demanding for your release?" Jerry shakes his head again. "I'm not a hostage Uncle. I joined these men and women on my own volition. I... I hope to end this war. Can't you see how pointless this is? We fight this endless war for what? When does it end? Ever? There's infinite universes, surely you can see how pointless this is!"

Jerry tries to continue, but Vance cuts him off. "You.. you left the protectorate? Then Cyra... Cyra... no. No, this can't be... A-and my nephew? A traitor? My own... nephew?" A tear comes to Vance's eye, but he wipes it away immediately, then turns his back to the screen. "Enough of this. If this is your decision, then so be it. You will die a short sighted fool, just as the Renegade. Goodbye, Jerome."

Jerry collapses to his knees, shocked and speechless as how easily he was betrayed. "I should have known..." Jerry chokes up a sob, and holds his head in his hands while tears form puddles on the ground.

removeCrew.text: Jerry sits in the corner, crying. The Flagship approaches, weapons charging. You want to console him, but you have to get going.

event.text: Suddenly, Jerry gets back up to his feet, wiping away the tears. "Well, there's only one thing left to do now." He draws out a massive Gatling gun. You aren't sure where he got it from, but you don't have the time to question it.
Before you can proceed on to the Flagship, Jerry pauses, and walks out of the room.

removeCrew.text: You have no idea where Jerry is going, but you follow him.

event.text: Jerry enters the room where the Equinoid is sleeping...

removeCrew.text: You have no idea what Jerry is doing, and watch in confusion.

event.text: Then, Jerry proceeds to mount the pony! "Alright. Now I'm ready."
Before you can proceed on to the Flagship, Jerry pauses, and walks out of the room.

removeCrew.text: You have no idea where Jerry is going, but you follow him.

event.text: Jerry enters the room where the Equinoid is sleeping...

removeCrew.text: You have no idea what Jerry is doing, and watch in confusion.

event.text: Then, Jerry proceeds to mount the pony! "Alright. Now I'm ready."

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_2
event.text: You chase down the Flagship and discover it is heavily damaged from the previous fight. Scans indicate that it has redirected considerable power to its drones. Get ready for a fight.
The Flagship might be weakened, but it is still formidable. Keep up the fight!

Suddenly, a small automated vessel breaks off from the fleet in the distance. You receive a hail from the shuttle. "Hello. This is an automated message sent from Admiral Vance of the Rebel fleet. We have taken into consideration your past victories, and the considerable damage you have already dealt to the Flagship. With this in mind, the Rebellion no longer holds interest in this reality. We offer our surrender."

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_3
event.text: You're not certain how it's able to keep fighting with the amount of damage it has sustained. It looks like it's transferred power to defensive systems as well as... some kind of super weapon. Be prepared... this is it!

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_3_VANCE
event.text: As you approach the Flagship for a third time, an ASB shot flies past your ship and nearly collides with the Flagship. In the distance, the Rebel forces have turned amongst each other. It appears as though word of Vance's betrayal has caught on, and it's created a schism in their forces. Expect additional fire support during this final stretch!

event.name: BOSS_NEGOTIATE_1
event.text: "So, you can invade the homeworlds of some barbaric aliens and convince them to turn against themselves. That is nothing compared to the mission of our movement! We seek to bring peace to galaxy. I doubt you know anything of peace."

choice.text: We saved an entire city and memorial from a siege put on by the Rebellion.
We came to an alliance with the Primal Reaper by helping them repel one of your assaults.
We saved the last of an endangered alien species from the EHG.
We liberated an entire civilian sector from the hacker clan.
We managed to convince the Crystalline Empress herself to be open to the rest of the galaxy.
The Rebellion is not peaceful! The Federation is what's bringing peace to the galaxy.

event.text: The commander laughs. "Oh, how pitiful. To bring peace, there must first be war! The Rebellion will rid of the dangerous xenos of each reality. I tire of this conversation. There will be no peaceful resolution to this confrontation." He cuts comms, and the Flagship continues to charge its weapons.

event.name: BOSS_NEGOTIATE_2
event.text: "And how might have you accomplished those? Through killing? As to be expected. The Federation and Rebellion are not any different when it comes to war, but where the Federation is weak, the Rebellion will stand strong! You have delayed this fight for too long. I doubt you would be capable of taking on a ship as powerful as this!"

choice.text: We destroyed one of your Flagships back in the Rebel Stronghold. If we did it once, we can do it again.
We destroyed the original Flagship in the Spectral Wastelands. If we did it once, we can do it again.
It's no Flagship, but we destroyed an Auto-Dreadnaught. We can handle anything the Rebellion throws at us.
It's no Flagship, but we destroyed an advanced W.I. Auto-Cruiser prototype. We can handle anything the Rebellion throws at us.
It's no Flagship, but we destroyed an MFK Gunboat. We can handle anything the Rebellion throws at us.
It's no Flagship, but we destroyed a stolen Rebel Gunboat. We can handle anything the Rebellion throws at us.

event.text: The commander chuckles. "Indeed we will. There will be no peaceful resolution to this confrontation, let us prepare for battle." He cuts comms, and the Flagship continues to charge its weapons.

event.name: BOSS_NEGOTIATE_3
event.text: "So you are the one responsible for that? Mighty impressive, but that ship was nothing compared to what you're about to face! You will find our Flagship is far better prepared for a tiny cruiser like yours. Enough delay, you will not escape this fight."

event.name: NODE17_FREEMANTIS_GLORY
event.text: A Free Mantis Dropship approaches. "Federation friends! The Pakatakalaka clan happy to see you! We having made it all the way out here to help. Just us, though, rest busy back home... but we having no glory there! We wanting collect many Rebel skulls! Our ship having many troubles with Rebel missiles though..."

choice.text: We're short on crew, do you want to join us?

event.text: "Are you having teleporter? Then yes! For the honor of Federation!"

choice.text: We're short on crew, do you want to join us?

event.text: "Are you having teleporter? Then yes! For the honor of Federation!"

choice.text: We're short on crew, do you want to join us?

event.text: "If we are joining your crew, we are having to stay on board your ship... Not want! Wanting to kill Rebels up close!"

choice.text: (Aether Technology) Offer them some advanced shield technology.
Offer to take a look at their engines.

event.text: "Renegade is wanting to spar? Then let the winner destroying the Rebels!"
"Wishing you well too!"

choice.text: (Aether Technology) Offer them some advanced shield technology.
Offer to take a look at their engines.

event.text: "Renegade is wanting to spar? Then let the winner destroying the Rebels!"
"Wishing you well too!"

event.name: NODE17_MANTIS_AETHER
event.text: You upgrade their shields using your Aether technology. They should be able to ward off a few missile shots at the start of a fight.
"Renegade is doing impressive things! Can't thank enough!" The Pakatakalaka shower you with scrap and a complementary gift.

event.name: NODE17_MANTIS_ENGINE
event.text: Their engines are pretty rudimentary, but you have the scrap to bring them up to snuff. This will probably help them out at least a little bit.
"Grateful to Renegade for advice! Will keep engines upgraded from now on." The Pakatakalaka hand you a complementary gift.

event.name: NODE17_BLOCKADE
event.text: On the nearby planet, a massive battle between the Federation and Rebel invaders is raging on. You receive a hail from a Federation Dropship still trying to make its way through the atmosphere.

"How'd you get down there so quickly? Nevermind, doesn't matter. We're supposed to be bringing reinforcements, but we can't get past the Rebel blockade. Since you're already down there, do you think you could help our troops? It could be the difference between victory and defeat."

You find the Federation battalion. They're in bad shape, and are cornered in the city's center. Their commander, a young man by the name of Conrad, gratefully receives you. "We don't have much time until the Rebels find us and rain all hell on our forces. We need to be as prepared as we can be. If you can help in any way, it would be greatly appreciated."
"Perfect, this'll help us greatly. Thank you so much Captain."
"Perfect, this'll help us greatly. Thank you so much Captain."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Provide medical attention to the soldiers.

event.text: "Perfect, this'll help us greatly. Thank you so much Captain."

choice.text: (Med-bots) Provide medical attention to the soldiers.

event.text: "Perfect, this'll help us greatly. Thank you so much Captain."

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Dispatch the drone to fix up their equipment.

event.text: "Perfect, this'll help us greatly. Thank you so much Captain."

choice.text: (Medical Drone) Dispatch the drone to heal the wounded.

event.text: "Perfect, this'll help us greatly. Thank you so much Captain."

While the soldiers are gathering to prepare, Conrad pulls you aside with another soldier. "I'm going to be totally honest here, this mission is doomed. I have a duty to serve here, and I cannot abandon my men. However, this man is my brother. I can't let him die here with me. He will serve faithfully on your ship."
"We have no use for this. It's a ship mounted weapon that fell off a Rebel ship we shot down, but as you can see we have no ship to mount it to. I hope it serves you well."

"I can't say whether this will help or not, but the Federation supplied us with maps of the sector. I'm sure you have more use for it than us. And in case it doesn't, here's an augment we no longer need."

event.name: NODE17_MILITIA
event.text: "It is an honor to serve the Federation! This is the last stand of our reality, and you are surely the last one capable of saving us! Anything you need, we will give you." The Militiaman pounds their chest in a traditional Unionist display of loyalty.
The Militia ship beams over a team of repairmen who get to fixing up your hull at once. They salute one last time before jumping away to return to the fight.
The Militia ship beams a weapon from their cargo that they aren't using. They salute one last time before jumping away to return to the fight.

The Militia ship beams over a soldier from their crew, who swears to do everything in their power to assist you. The rest of the Militiamen salute one last time before jumping away to return to the fight.
Agast at your sudden betrayal, the Militia ship puts up as best a fight it can against you.

event.name: NODE17_CIVILIANS
event.text: A Union civilian ship is attempting to escape from the ever-present dangers of this sector. "Whether the Federation wins or not, there's no safety left in this damn place! We have to get out of here... damn it, we have to flee this reality! Please, we're almost out of fuel. Do you have any to spare?"
You transfer your fuel to the Unionists.
"Oh thank you Captain. This is why we've always supported the Federation. Just make sure you glass that Flagship so it doesn't all go to waste." The Civilians give you some scrap.

choice.text: We have no need for this fuel anymore. Give them as much as we can.

event.text: You transfer your fuel to the Unionists.

"Oh my... This is so much more than we could ever need. We'll certainly be able to escape with all of this! This is why I've always supported the Federation. Just make sure you glass that Flagship so it doesn't all go to waste." The Civilians are so grateful, they give you a military grade weapon that they no longer need on their ship, as well as some scrap.
Unfortunately, you cannot risk letting go of your fuel reserves at that point. You apologize to the Union ship and decline.

event.name: NODE17_DISGUISE
event.text: The ship nearby is broadcasting a call on Federation channels. "This is Captain Boggs of the Federation fleet. We are requesting support from any nearby ships in the local system."

choice.text: Do they think we're stupid? Attack!

event.text: You catch the captain of the ship saying, "Crap, they're onto us. Ready the weapons!"
The ship is surprised that you're helping them, but they gleefully accept the supplies.
You fly away from the strange ship and mute their call.
The ship's crew thanks you. "I know the ship may be a bit suspicious, but our original was destroyed. We were forced to board this one, and hastily painted over it. Here, have this as thanks."
"Hahahah! You absolute idiot! You moron! You complete nincompoop! You dunce! You walnut-brained incompetent buffoon! I can't believe you fell for it! Now you shall die!"

event.name: NODE17_DEPOT
event.text: This beacon is home to a makeshift Rebel drop point, a place for transport ships to deliver supplies. It's protected by a well armed MFK guard, but if you can destroy it any supplies currently kept at the platform will be yours.
You raise your weapons and attack the guard.
You move past the platform and continue on your mission.

event.name: NODE17_DEPOT_WIN
event.text: You've defeated the guard. You scrap the remains before investigating the platform.
The platform appears to be completely unmanned. You steal as many supplies as you can, and a military grade weapon.

event.name: NODE17_EVACUATIONS
event.text: A Federation city at this beacon is underway with evacuations. A few Rebel ships are skirmishing with the border patrol, but the real threat lies at a distant but quickly approaching Rebel squadron. A few massive Federation Heavy Carryships are collecting civilians, but they won't arrive in time before the Rebels can begin their full attack.

choice.text: Pick up as many civilians as possible and bring them to the Carryships.

event.text: You manage to rescue a few dozen civilians. It's extremely cramped in the cargobay, but it's all worth it. Most of the civilians hurry out of your storage into the safety of the Carryship, except for one, who offers to stay behind and aid you in your mission.
As you're leaving, you notice an Elite Rebel ship tailing you. A fight is unavoidable.
It's too risky to endanger your ship in such a way when you're so close to the final battle. You hope most of the civilians can make it out alive.

event.name: NODE17_EGGMAN
event.text: A Rebel fleet has gathered around a planet with a rather largely populated Federation metropolis built upon it. It appears the leader of the fleet, an overly rotund and almost egg shaped man aboard an Engineer vessel, is shouting at a crowd that has gathered in response.

The engineer frantically gestures while he speaks. "-I've come to make an announcement: Colonel Hedge is a bitch ass idiot. He slept with my wife. That's right, he-" there's some fumbling with the mic, but the speech promptly resumes, "was "THIS BIG", and I said 'That's disgusting!' So I'm making a call-out to all of you! Hedge, you've-" again, the mic cuts out momentarily. "It's the size of this ship, except way smaller! And guess what? Here's what mine looks like!"

The crowd screams as a massive ASB cannon extends out of one of the nearby fleet ships. "That's right baby! He slept with my wife, so guess what, I'm gonna... uh... sleep with this planet!" The humongous ASB cannon fires, but the shot travels much higher, missing the planet and striking the moon instead, causing the giant rock to shatter as if it were made of glass. "That's right, this is what you get, my SUPER LASER CANNON! HOW DO YOU LIKE THAT, HEDGE? I SLEPT WITH THE MOON, YOU IDIOT! You have 23 minutes before I get bored of waiting and destroy this entire city. You will surrender yourself immediately. Now get out of my sight, before I sleep with all of you too!" The transmission ends.
You move to attack the Engineer ship. Unfortunately, the fleet is also firing upon you from a distance.

choice.text: Hunt down Hedge and force him to surrender.

event.text: It seems many people in the crowd had the same ideas as you, and people have begun to gather around Hedge's ship, but he's already begun the climb into the atmosphere by the time you arrive. Fortunately for you, you have a ship to follow him with, and you rocket off in his direction. In the distance, it appears the fleet is firing at both of you!

choice.text: Leave before you get slept with.

event.text: Nothing good can await the crowd below, but there's nothing you can do about it now.

event.name: NODE17_FLEETSHIP_ARGUE
event.text: This beacon is under attack by a squadron of Rebel fleet ships! They're targeting a populated planet with several large cities.

choice.text: Hail the Rebels and demand they cease firing on civilians.

event.text: The leader of the Rebel squadron responds, glaring at you with a smirk. "You want us to stop our attack? Are you daft, thinking we would take orders from an enemy Renegade vessel? No less a repugnant one from Universe 0?"

choice.text: Think of how many human lives are on that planet! Your attack will kill them as well as the aliens you seek to rid this galaxy of!

event.text: "You speak elegantly, but we have already calculated this sacrifice. The lives of a few will be traded for the good of the many. It's simple arithmetic."

choice.text: What if we could tip the scales?

event.text: The Rebel captain nods slowly. "Uhuh... I see where you're heading. But what possibly could you give us that would be worth giving up this chance today?"
You present your offer to the Rebel, hoping to reach out their better side.
"You think this is going to do anything? I'll make this in an hour from business investments." The Rebel spits and turns away from you.
Indignant, you raise your weapons and attack the Rebel ship.
You double down on the bribe, increasing the scrap in hopes it'll make the Rebels leave. The Rebel captain ponders this for a few moments...

event.name: FLEETSHIP_ARGUE_BRIBE
event.text: "You make an interesting offer. It's still not much all things considered, but it's enough to make me... reconsider. I don't know for what reason a butcher like you cares so heavily about civilian lives, but our fleet is needed elsewhere anyways."

Once the Rebels have jumped away, the civilians below cheer for you. "We knew from the beginning what Universe 1 would do to us, but we'll never give into their brutish methods! The Federation needs all the help it can! Take everything we can offer, and stop that Flagship!"
You propose a hefty amount of scrap in hopes it'll get the Rebels to reconsider and leave. The Rebel captain ponders this for a few moments...

choice.text: Oh, nothing. I was just hypothesizing.

event.text: "How disappointing, but not unexpected. It seems this was all nothing but a waste of time. Now get out of my way, Renegade scum."
The Rebel captain turns silently momentarily, staring blanky at you. Next thing you know, the ship's weapons are hot and they're firing at you!

choice.text: The Rebellion has better things to do than attacking innocent civilians.

event.text: The Rebel captain snickers. "Of course, of course! Your point is clear. Why waste time attacking civilians, when there's a Renegade in need of handling!"

choice.text: There's no way that we can help.

event.text: A tragic fate awaits the innocent lives on that planet, but there's nothing you can do.

choice.text: Prepare to fight the Rebel ship!

event.text: You move in to intercept.

choice.text: There's no time, get ready to jump.

event.text: You try to block out the horrors of war and focus on your mission.

textList.name: TEXT_NODE17_RESCUE
textList.text: Shots fly by your port windows followed by a Rebel scout in pursuit of a damaged cruiser. Should we move in to engage?
There seems to be a small Federation colony under attack by a Rebel forward scout. Will you protect them?

A number of large transports are being pursued by a Rebel bombing squadron. One bomber has managed to slip through the defensive fire, and is poised to wreak havoc among the enormous yet vulnerable transports. There's time for you to advance and take it out!
A battle rages nearby between small fighters; apparently fighting over a space station. The Federation appears to be losing ships fast. Shall we assist them?
A civilian ship is broadcasting a request for assistance on a secure Federation channel. They are being harassed by Rebel scouts. Will you respond?

event.text: The people you rescued were primarily refugees fleeing the conflict. They offer you their sincere gratitude, but cannot extend anything more.
You are hailed, "Thank you! It's not much but we can repair a bit of damage before you jump off into the war. Good luck!"
The survivors send a message, "Thanks for the support, I don't know how much longer we could have held on. Take some supplies, we probably won't need them at this point."

event.name: DISTRESS_NODE17_DECAYING_ORBIT
event.text: The remnants of a battle litter this beacon. The surface of a nearby planet is desperately sending out a distress call about a wrecked defense satellite that is currently falling out of orbit. It will likely cause both short and long-term harm. Unfortunately, an aggressive Rebel ship is flying towards you. You only have a short time to address the situation before the Rebel starts attacking!

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Quickly tow the satellite back into orbit.

event.text: Using your ship's powerful engines, you attach your ship to the satellite and steer it back into orbit. The Rebel arrives just as you finish.

choice.text: (Adv. Cloaking) Cloak your ship as you tow the satellite.

event.text: You cloak your ship to buy yourself enough time to correct the satellite's decaying orbit. Once your cloak wears off however, the Rebel is quick to attack.

choice.text: (Pilot Jammer) Turn off the incoming Rebel's piloting to buy yourself enough time to tow the satellite.

event.text: The Rebel ship starts to drift as their ship loses control. This gives you the time to correct the satellite's orbit before the fight can start!

choice.text: (Engine Jammer) Jam the incoming Rebel's engines to buy yourself enough time to tow the satellite.

event.text: The Rebel ship sputters as the engines falter. This gives you the time to correct the satellite's orbit before the fight can start!

choice.text: Try to steer the satellite back in place.

event.text: Try as you might, you don't have the time to fix the orbit of the satellite. The Rebel ship arrives before you make any progress.

event.name: NODE17_SATELLITE_SAVED
event.text: With the satellite orbit properly corrected, the planet expresses their gratitude. You're given a hefty amount of scrap and a weapon to boot!

event.name: DISTRESS_NODE17_FLAMINGFED
event.text: The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a nearby Union refueling station, but before you can hail the station yourself, you receive a hail from a Federation officer on board.

"Thank god someone arrived in time. Our ship sustained heavy damage near a class-M dwarf star. We managed to teleport to this station, but we couldn't reach the engine controls through the flames... and our now vacant ship is on a collision course with the station. Please, help us. Help us all."
You move to intercept the out-of-control ship.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The station's proximity alarms begin blaring over your comms - if you're going to stop this ship, you're going to have to work fast!

choice.text: (Manning Drone) Attempt to steer the ship remotely.

event.text: You send your drone over towards the Federation ship, and direct it towards the cockpit. The fires threaten to melt the drone before it can even reach the controls, but it manages to steer the ship away from the station before impact.

The owner of the station returns your hail when you return. "Your counterparts aboard the station explained to me what you just did for us. Please, we aren't a large station, but help yourself to whatever you need. None of us would still be here to have this conversation if you hadn't arrived."

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Force the ship to stop.

event.text: You launch a hacking probe towards the Federation ship, and your ship computer soon registers a change in course trajectory. Satisfied, you return to the Union station to inform them that the problem has been resolved.

The owner of the station returns your hail when you return. "Your counterparts aboard the station explained to me what you just did for us. Please, we aren't a large station, but help yourself to whatever you need. None of us would still be here to have this conversation if you hadn't arrived."

choice.text: (Rock Plating) Ram the ship out of the way.

event.text: As your hull impacts the out-of-control Federation ship, you can see the structure of the damaged ship threaten to buckle under the sheer force of the collision. However, your ship computer soon shows a corrected flight path for the vessel, and you return to the station to collect your reward.
As you spool up your FTL drive, you try not to focus on the Federation ship fast approaching in the distance. None of this will matter if you don't stop the Flagship.

Whatever this distress call is for, it won't matter if the Rebels win the battle. As you prepare to jump away, you can see another Federation vessel approaching in the distance - hopefully they'll be able to resolve the issue.

event.name: SHIP_CRASH_INTO_STATION
event.text: As the Federation ship races towards the station, you and your crew are helpless to stop it. Fragments from the collision shred your hull as the two constructs are turned into a metallic mist upon impact.

event.name: NODE17_SPECTATOR
event.text: A Slug ship is at this beacon. Their captain appears to be eating some alien version of popcorn. "Oh, well if it isn't the sssship everyone'sss been looking for. I wondered if I'd ssssee you here. Thiss really is ssssuch an interesssssting experience. We have no part to play here, but ssssometimesss you just want to see a good ssshow, you know?"
"Aw crap!-" the Slug is cut off by a Rebel ship flying by. A shot pierces the Slug hull, and the Rebel locks onto you.

It appears the Slug captain is still alive, though his ship and crew are barely holding together. The Slug doesn't seem fazed by the imminent destruction of his ship. "Hah! You sssshowed that Rebel what for. That'ssss what I call entertainment. Though, you can ssssee my ssship won't hold together long, and my crew isss doomed. Perhapsss I will ssstick with you, ssso I can sssssee this ssspectacle all the way to the end."
It seems none of the Slugs survived. Disappointed, you take what remains from their ship.

textList.name: TEXT_NODE17_ENCOUNTER_REBEL
textList.text: A Rebel ship jumps after you, warming up its weapons as soon as it arrives. "Renegade! You've evaded the fleet for too long! You die, here and now!"
"So, the fleet let a Renegade through? How annoying. You'll never make it to the Flagship as long as I'm alive!" The Rebel turns to fight.
A Rebel ship moves to intercept you as you arrive at this beacon. There's no hesitating now, a fight is inevitable.
A Rebel breaks away from the fighting to face you. "Another Fed ship...? Will this war ever end?" Even through all this musing, they're intent upon fighting you.
A Rebel hails you, a crazed expression on his face. "Why do you persist? Can't you see the Rebellion is destined to succeed?" He confidently readies his weapon systems.
The warfare is unending in this sector. A Rebel is waiting for you at this beacon, and they're intent upon destroying you!
"Give up! Your insipid Federation is about to fall! You may as well surrender now and throw yourself at our mercy!"

textList.name: TEXT_NODE17_ENCOUNTER_MV
textList.text: A MV Rebel is finishing off a Federation ship at this beacon. The moment you arrive, they shift their attention to your ship instead!
"All that time and effort traveling to this 'verse... What a waste! It ends here!" The Rebel attacks you after closing communications.
A Rebel arrives at the same time as you. "This universe will achieve a Rebel victory! I won't let you interfere!" They're preparing for a fight!
You're not the only multiversal belligerent here - a Rebel from another universe is defending this beacon from Federation ships!
Even in this sector, the Multiversal Rebels follow you. They wordlessly prepare to attack you!
"Another universe will fall to the Rebels! Our hour of triumph is at hand!" They're readying their opening attack!

textList.name: TEXT_NODE17_ENCOUNTER_AUTO
textList.text: It seems the Rebellion is pulling no punches now - a brand new Auto model from Wentworth Innovations is deployed from the Engineer fleet to handle you while the bulk of the engagement goes on in the distance.
You aren't sure at first, but your eyes aren't deceiving you. A highly advanced Auto-ship has locked onto your vessel and is firing its full arsenal!
It seems Wentworth Innovations has given everything it's got towards the Rebellion's efforts here. An Innovation vessel is deployed from the fleet in the distance as soon as you're detected.

"Activating quality assurance mode. Running bootup protocols. Combat testing engaged. Please do not interrupt combat assessment or proceeding diagnostics." It seems this Auto-ship is brand new - so new its first test is against you!
A Rebel Auto-ship hurtles past you, nearly colliding with your hull, then stops and returns to engage you. You're visibly a higher priority than its prior target!

event.name: NODE17_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE
event.text: A pirate ship comes careening towards you. "God damn it, god damn it, god DAMN IT! We need to get away from this bloody sector! Get out of our way!"

event.name: NODE17_ENCOUNTER_ENGINEER
event.text: A Rebel Engineer fleet has taken a bold moment of direct action and engaged the Federation fleet nearby! Though likely only out of necessity, an Engineer vessel breaks off to handle you.

event.name: NODE17_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_STATION
event.text: Unfortunately, it seems the Rebels have secured control over this beacon! A hastily thrown together Rebel outpost readies to defend against you.

event.name: NODE17_PANDORAS_BOX
event.text: A very strangely colored pirate ship is already here. They hail you. "We are the keepers of the box. Only he who is truly worthy may wield the box's power."
The pirate moves closer to the screen, staring deep into your eyes for a minute or two. "Yeah sure, why the hell not. Have fun."

choice.text: "WARNING: unknown anomalous artifact detected. Scheduled for [QUARANTINE]."

event.text: The pirate says nothing more. You fly away until you can no longer see them.

event.name: NODE17_REPAIR_STATION
event.text: You jump into the system, noticing the nearby repair station signal.
It looks as though a Rebel Elite is firing on the repair station! You'll have to clear these guys out first before you can get assistance.
It looks as though an MFK Ace is firing on the repair station! You'll have to clear these guys out first before you can get assistance.

event.name: BOSS_REPAIR_STATION_FIGHT
event.text: Fortunately, with the Rebels out of the way, you're able to access the station. They're beaten up, but still able to supply you with what you need.

textList.name: NODE17_REPAIR_STATION
textList.text: There is a mobile ship construction platform stationed at this beacon. After a brief exchange they give you clearance to receive emergency repairs and military supplies.
An Engi civilian ship-yard has been converted into a military refueling station. They offer you the chance to patch up your ship and refresh some supplies.
Chatter on the comm suggests the nearby Federation base is outfitted with a repair station. When you forward your mission priority they quickly help repair your ship and give you some supplies.
A forward construction station is in the process of repairing damaged warships. Your command codes convince them to do a quick patch job on your ship.
A trade station was abandoned nearby. Some Federation engineers repurposed their shipyard to perform military repairs. They offer to help fix your ship.
